data.title: New Arrivals
data.text:
A stage used finger guitar pick given by blues great Muddy Waters to an Australian fan in 1973, with a photograph of the fan and Muddy Waters taken backstage at his concert...

A concert program from the Bob Dylan 30th Anniversary Concert. On October 16, 1992 Madison Square Garden played host to the all-star concert Columbia Records Celebrates the Music of Bob Dylan, informally...

A copy of The Doors third album, Waiting for the Sun, boldly signed by Jim Morrison on an adhesive label applied to the inner gatefold. Morrison signed the album for noted English...

A large 1984 Australian poster advertising The Saints new single "Imagination", new album A Little Madness to be Free, and tour dates in Sydney, Melbourne, Adelaide, and Brisbane. The large poster with...

A scarce color advance proof of the teaser movie poster for Jonathan Demme’s 1984 cult classic Stop Making Sense, a concert film of the rock band Talking Heads, which was shot over...

Two 1978 Warner Bros. Records promotional posters for the soundtrack album to The Last Waltz, the acclaimed Martin Scorsese documentary of The Band’s farewell concert at the Winterland Ballroom in San Francisco,...

Two receipts from Music City, a San Francisco instrument and equipment store, for four JBL speakers, one of which is signed by Big Brother & The Holding Company bassist and 'leader' Peter...

A scarce 'last minute' handbill advertising the Velvet Underground, Butterfield Blues Band, Sly & The Family Stone and the Rockets (pre-Crazy Horse) at LA's Shrine Auditorium July 12-13, 1968. This handbill was...

A vintage live photograph of Velvet Underground guitarist Sterling Morrison, taken circa 1969 during a Velvets live performance, by an unknown photographer. This was part of Velvet's guitarist legendary archive of Velvet...

A scarce 1977 Sex Pistols promotional poster issued by Warner Bros. Records in 1977 to promote their album Never Mind The Bollocks. American designer Ronn Spencer designed this day-glo classic, explaining “When...

A scarce and likely unplayed 1968 French first pressing of Jimi Hendrix’s masterpiece double album Electric Ladyland, with the very rare silver foil sticker noting this album was awarded the prestigious Grand...

A stunning original vintage photograph of David Bowie circa 1972, during his Ziggy Stardust prime, by Mick Rock (1948-2021). Rock was a close friend of Bowie's and the photographer most closely associated...

A vintage unpublished live photograph of MC5 singer Rob Tyner (1944-1991), from the collection of Danny Fields, the Elektra Records 'house hippy' who signed the MC5. We can find this image nowhere...

A 1968 Bizarre Records promotional reprint of Frank Zappa's article The Oracle Has It All, from Life Magazine's June 28, 1968 issue. This issue featured the cover story The New Rock. The...

A very rare 1967 membership card for London's legendary Marquee Club,expiring December 31, 1967 . The Marquee was the most important club in London, and 1967 was the year many consider the...

A beautiful handbill advertising Bob Dylan's February 12, 1966 concert at the Norfolk, Virginia Municipal Auditorium. Backed by The Hawks, later to become The Band, this show took place at a pivotal...

A perfect, factory sealed vinyl copy of Dave Chapelle's Sticks and Stones. This 2 LP version was never commercially released, and is exceedingly rare. This example, with fully intact shrink wrap and...

A very scarce white label promotional copy of Queen's 1973 self-titled debut album, with an 'Airplay Suggestions' sticker on the front cover, and a 'Preview' promotional flyer reading 'British Rock In The...

A rare 1977 vintage Bob Gruen photograph of the Ramones at their early home base, CBGB, from the collection of the group's original manager Danny Fields. This rare photograph, printed near the...
